sentences.en: Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc.
Brass is formed by the fusion of copper and zinc.
sentences.cn: 黄铜是通过铜和锌的熔合而成的.

sentences.en: Chile is the world's largest producer of copper.
sentences.cn: 智利是世界上最大的产铜国。

sentences.en: Contemporary photographs are juxtaposed with a sixteenth century, copper Portuguese mirror.
sentences.cn: 几幅当代照片和一面16世纪的葡萄牙铜镜并排摆在一起。

sentences.en: Copper is a good conductor of heat.
Copper is a good medium for the conduction of heat and electricity.
El Salvador produces 100,000 tons of refined copper annually.
sentences.cn: 萨尔瓦多每年生产10万吨纯铜。

sentences.en: He makes decorative vessels in copper, stainless steel and silver.
sentences.cn: 他用铜、不锈钢和银制造装饰性器皿。

sentences.en: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.cn: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.en: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.cn: 他的头发又变回原来的淡红棕色。

sentences.en: the fusion of copper and zinc to produce brass
The students are asked to prove the purity of copper.
sentences.cn: 要求学生们检验铜的纯度.

sentences.en: The worker worked in a little copper with the alloy.
sentences.cn: 工人在合金里搀了一点铜.

sentences.en: We tried to grow some copper sulphate crystals with our children.
sentences.cn: 我们想跟孩子们一起制作硫酸铜晶体。

sentences.en: When nitric acid is poured on copper, a brown vapor gives off.
sentences.cn: 将硝酸倒在铜上, 会散发出一种棕色的蒸气.

words.tran_cn: 含铜的；铜制的；铜一样的

trans.tran_en: Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour
a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
